intro: Onoseris adpressa, commonly known as the narrowleaf helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and it has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Onoseris adpressa is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
